javaslang

Interface Algebra.Monad<A,M extends Algebra.HigherKinded<?,M>>

  • Type Parameters:
    A - Component type of this monad.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Algebra.Functor<A>, Algebra.HigherKinded<A,M>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    List<T>, Option<T>, Stream<T>, Try<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    List.AbstractList, List.Cons, List.Nil, Option.None, Option.Some, Stream.AbstractStream, Stream.Cons, Stream.Deferred, Stream.Nil, Try.Failure, Try.Success
    Enclosing class:
    Algebra

    public static interface Algebra.Monad<A,M extends Algebra.HigherKinded<?,M>>
extends Algebra.Functor<A>, Algebra.HigherKinded<A,M>
    Defines a Monad by generalizing the flatMap and unit functions.

    All instances of the Monad interface should obey the three monad laws:

    • Left identity: unit(a).flatMap(f) ≡ f a
    • Right identity: m.flatMap(unit) ≡ m
    • Associativity: m.flatMap(f).flatMap(g) ≡ m.flatMap(x -> f.apply(x).flatMap(g)
